tool_description: sentiment-analysis, text-summarization, language-detection, article-extraction, named-entity-recognition, extract-text from documents and images
name: Text Analysis
title: Text Analysis

api_list.name: sentiment-analysis
api_list.description:
Sentiment analysis is the use of natural language processing to systematically identify and extract subjective information. Sentiment analysis is widely applied to  movie reviews and survey responses.

API spec
-----------
max characters allowed: 1000 chars
supported languages: English

NOTE
--------
Support for other languages will come soon.
The API is free during beta period. Pricing will be updated soon.
api_list.code:
import requests

url = "https://text-analysis12.p.rapidapi.com/sentiment-analysis/api/v1.1"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "text-analysis12.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.post(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())

utterances.utterance: Analyze the sentiment of this movie review: 'The film was a breathtaking masterpiece with stunning visuals and a gripping storyline.'
What is the sentiment of the following text: 'I had a terrible experience with the customer service at the store.'
Determine the sentiment of this feedback: 'The product quality exceeded my expectations and I am very satisfied.'
Can you analyze the sentiment of this comment: 'The concert was a complete waste of time and money.'
What sentiment does this sentence convey: 'I am thrilled with the new features in the latest software update.'
Please perform sentiment analysis on this statement: 'The weather today is gloomy and depressing.'
Analyze the sentiment of this tweet: 'Just finished reading an amazing book that I couldn't put down!'
What is the sentiment of this review: 'The restaurant had excellent service and delicious food.'
Determine the sentiment of this message: 'I am disappointed with the slow delivery of my order.'
Can you analyze the sentiment of this feedback: 'The new policy changes are beneficial and well-received by the team.'

api_list.name: named-entity-recognition
api_list.description: Named entity recognition is a task of information extraction that seeks to locate and classify named entities mentioned in unstructured text into pre-defined categories such as person names, organizations, locations, time expressions, quantities, monetary values, percentages, etc.

        }

Can you extract the names of organizations and locations from this article on global warming?
Find all the person names mentioned in the biography of Albert Einstein.
What are the time expressions in the news report about the upcoming Olympics?
Extract monetary values from the financial report of Tesla.

api_list.name: extract-text-from-files
api_list.description:
Extract text from files like
"csv, doc, docx, eml, epub, json, html, htm, msg, odt, pdf, pptx, ps, rtf, txt, xls, xlsx, gif, jpg, jpeg, png, tiff, tif, mp3, ogg, wav"

[For more information navigate to the Gitlab repository] (https://gitlab.com/t8511/extract-text-from-files-wiki)

utterances.utterance: Can you extract the text from this PDF document?
Please extract text from this Word file.
Extract the content from this image file.
I need the text from this Excel spreadsheet.
Can you get the text out of this PowerPoint presentation?
Please extract the text from this HTML file.
Extract text from this CSV file for me.
I need the text extracted from this audio file.
Can you extract the text from this TIFF image?
Please get the text from this JSON file.

api_list.name: summarize-text
api_list.description: Summarize a long article, story, etc.

api_list.name: language-detection
api_list.description:
Find out what all languages are present in your text.

API specs
------------
Max chars: 100000
Returns the probabilities of multiple languages.
Follows ISO 639-1 codes
link for the above codes: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_ISO_639-1_codes

[For more information visit Gitlab repository](https://gitlab.com/t8511/language-detection-wiki)
api_list.code:
import requests

url = "https://text-analysis12.p.rapidapi.com/language-detection/api/v1.1"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "text-analysis12.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.post(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())
